text: almonds are kind of the perfect package
they're full of heart-healthy
monounsaturated fat fiber and protein
and if you've got ten minutes you've got
a batch of homemade almond butter all
you need is a food processor two cups of
toasted almonds to process it for about
eight to ten minutes scraping down the
sides periodically until it's smooth and
creamy and away we go starting to get
creamy mmm this is so creamy and it
smells like toasted almonds now we are
going to season this with a little bit
of salt let me go with teaspoon of
course you can also use sea salt any
salt you desire process it a little bit
longer so I like to store most things in
glass when possible because it doesn't
pick up any strange flavors and you
don't have to worry about BPA or any
other sort of additives you can see how
creamy and rich and smooth and beautiful
this was and this really only took about
seven or eight minutes there's a super
fast food processor this will be good
for about a week in the fridge so before
you use it just give it a good stir as
the fats tend to separate what's
interesting is that we started with two
cups of almonds and now we have one cup
of almond butter my almond butter is all
ready to go can't wait to use it on my
next a B&J
